rooms.Name: A Waterfall
rooms.Description:
This is the violent, rushing waterfall on the soulease river.  You find that
the water pressure is too severe, and you are pummeled against the rocks
at the base of the fall.  It hurts.  A lot.

Exits.Description: To the west, the Soulease river winds it's way westward.

rooms.Name: A Modern City Street
rooms.Description:
You find yourself standing on the edge of a busy, modern city street.  Cars
are whizzing past you at breakneck speeds, and the smell of exhaust and burnt
rubber fill the air.  This is a busy 5-lane city highway, but you think you
can make it across to the other side safely, you hope.

Exits.Description: You see the busy city street
To the south, you can see a small dirt path, leading to a dirt road.

rooms.Name: City Street
rooms.Description:
You were, unfortunately, wrong.  As you step off the curb, ready to dash
across the street, you hear a squealing noise, followed by a sudden, VERY
strong <THUD>, and you suddenly find yourself sailing through the air, only
to impact on the pavement rather painfully.  As you try to crane your neck
around to see what hit you, things start to fade to black.  The only thing
you can see is a bright red light, pulsing through the darkness...

Exits.Description: To the south, you can see the sidewalk along a busy city street.

rooms.Name: Kevin's Watch
rooms.Description:
You find yourself standing on a VERY high stone plateau, cut into the side
of an enourmous cliff.  From here, you can see for miles the lush, green,
natural beauty of a land filled with life.  As you look back, you can see
no entrance into the cliff.  Wherever you just came from is gone.  The only
exit you can see is a LONG staircase, cut into the very rock, which leads
down through the wispy clouds.  They looks solid, but if one were to slip,
the fall would be....very painful.

Exits.Description:
These stairs are very sturdy, but the winds make the climb treacherous.
Be careful on the climb down.

rooms.Name: Outside Mithil Stonedown
rooms.Description:
Here, at the base of the stairway leading up to Kevin's Watch, as you look
around, you see the beauty of the land was not exaggerated by the extreme
height from which you first saw it.  Lush and vibrant, this land seems the
very essence of life!  To the east, you can see the small village of Mithil
Stonedown.  A path leads directly into the the heart of town.

Exits.Description: This path leads into the center of Mithil Stonedown
This is the beginning of the LONG stairway up to Kevin's Watch

rooms.Name: A small, private home
rooms.Description:
This is a small house, made of cobbled stones mortared together.  It is very
simply made, but very durable, and almost resonates with earthpower, in a
subdued way.  It feels very inviting and warm.

Exits.Description: This door leads to the western edge of Mithil Stonedown
This door leads to the southern edge of Mithil Stonedown

rooms.Name: The southern edge of Mithil Stonedown
rooms.Description:
You are in a clearing between a small home and an older looking building,
south of the town square.  The wonderful smell of fresh baked bread is
wafting from the east, a small stonedown home sits to the west, and to the
south, the Southron Range provides a secure shield for the village.

Exits.Description: To the north, you see the Mithil Stonedown village square
The smell of freshly baked bread is coming from behind this door
This door leads to a small village home

rooms.Name: The Mithil Stonedown Bakery
rooms.Description:
This room smells of flour and fresh baked bread.  It is obvious this is the
place the village gets its baked goods, and from the smell, you can guess
why.

Exits.Description: This door leads to the southern edge of Mithil Stonedown

rooms.Name: The western edge of Mithil Stonedown
rooms.Description:
This is the western edge of the small village of Mithil Stonedown.  Here,
in the shadow of Kevin's Watch and the western edge of the Southron Range,
this community thrives with the help of the Gravelingases of the Rhadhamaerl,
who have mastered the art of coaxing the earthpower innate in stone from it,
and learned to shape this power and the stone it inhabits.  This is a close
knit, family oriented community, and you can see this in the way they greet
each other, and in the way they nod politely to you as they see you entering
the village limits.  To the south, you can see a small stonedown home.

Exits.Description: To the east, you can see the village square of Mithil Stonedown
You see a small stonedowner dwelling
This path leads west out of Mithil Stonedown, towards Kevin's Watch

rooms.Name: Mithil Stonedown Village Square
rooms.Description:
This is the center of Mithil Stonedown proper, as well as being the obvious
center of this village's social life.  Here wives share the local gossip,
children come out to play, and men come to exaggerate stories about their
various youths.  The sense of community here is staggering.  A building to
the east bears a strange symbol on the door.

Exits.Description:
To the north, you can see the northern edge of Mithil Stonedown, as well
as a path leading out of town.
To the east sits a building with an odd rune inscribed upon the door
To the south, you can see the southern edge of Mithil Stonedown
To the west, you can see the western edge of town

ExtraDescs.Description:
Above this door, a strange rune, resembling a mountain peak, has been
painstakingly carved.  This is the smoothest carving you have ever seen,
and it appears to signify something (or someone) of great importance.

rooms.Name: Gravelingases Workshop
rooms.Description:
This is the workplace of Mithin Stonedown's Rhadhamaerl.  It is in this place
the light and heat are coaxed from the very rocks to light and heat the
entire stonedown.  This place has that dusty smell you'd normally associate
with a quarry, but regardless, it's surprisingly warm and clean.

Exits.Description: This door leads to the village well
This door leads back to the Mithil Stonedown village square

rooms.Name: A small, private home
rooms.Description:
This is the home of the Rhadhamaerl for Mithil Stonedown.  Here, he, his
wife and his daughter live.  This place has a well worn, but well loved feeling
to it.  It is warm, well lit and inviting.

Exits.Description: This door leads back out to the northern edge of Mithil Stonedown

rooms.Name: Northern edge of Mithil Stonedown
rooms.Description:
This is the northern edge of Mithil Stonedown.  To the south you can see the
village square, to the east the village well, to the west a small private
home, and to the north, a lesser-travelled path leads out of the village into
the wilder land beyond.

Exits.Description: This path leads out of town
To the east you can see the village well
To the south you can see the center of the stonedown.
This door leads to a small, private residence

rooms.Name: Mithil Stonedown Well
rooms.Description:
This small alcove within Mithil Stonedown contains the village well.  This
is the central water source for the entire village, as well as a major
social gathering place for the villagers.  Much is duscussed here.

Exits.Description: This door leads to the Village Gravelingases workshop

To the west is the northern edge of Mithil Stonedown, as well as a path
leading north out of the village

rooms.Name: A path towards the woods
rooms.Description:
This is a well worn path, leading south into Mithil Stonedown, and northwest
into a wooded plain.  From here, you can see a single, large tree standing
tall in the center of the woods, as if ruling all it can see.

Exits.Description: To the south you can see the northern edge of Mithil Stonedown
To the northeast you can see a grassy forest

rooms.Name: A wooded plain
rooms.Description:
This wood is lush and vibrant.  Even without looking, you can just 'feel'
the life in this area.  To the northeast, you can see a clearing with a
single, large tree in it.  From that direction, you can hear the sound of
voices...

Exits.Description: To the north, the woods continue
To the east, the woods continue
You can see a large clearing with a single, towering tree in the center

rooms.Name: A wooded plain
rooms.Description:
This wood is lush and vibrant.  Even without looking, you can just 'feel' the
life in this area.  To the north, you can see a clearing with a single,
large tree in it.  From that direction, you can hear the sound of voices...

Exits.Description: You can see a large clearing with a single, towering tree in it
To the east, the woods continue
To the west, the wood continue
To the northeast, the woods continue
To the northwest, the woods continue

rooms.Name: A wooded plain
rooms.Description:
This wood is lush and vibrant.  Even without looking, you can just 'feel'
the life in this area.  To the northwest, you can see a clearing with a single
large tree in it.  From that direction, you can hear voices...

Exits.Description: To the north, the woods continue
To the west, the woods continue
You can see a large clearing with a single, towering tree in it
This path leads out of the wooded plains and towards Mithil Stonedown

rooms.Name: A wooded plain
rooms.Description:
This wood is lush and vibrant.  Even without looking, you can just 'feel'
the life in this area.  To the east, you can see a clearing with a single,
large tree in it.  From that direction, you can hear the sound of voices...

Exits.Description: To the north, the woods continue
You can see a large clearing with a single, towering tree in it
To the south, the woods continue
To the northeast, the woods continue
To the southeast, the woods continue

rooms.Name: The base of Revelwood
rooms.Description:
This is a large clearing in the midst of this wooded and grassy area.  Here,
you can see the base of an extremely large tree, which, as you look up, 
reaches high into the sky.  This is the tree-village of Revelwood, home of
the art of lillianrill, the wood-lore of the Land.  It is in these branches
that the hirebrands learn their craft to aid the people of the Land.  All
about you is evidence of their success.

Exits.Description: The path north leads back into the woods
The path east leads back to the woods
The path south leads back to the woods
The path west leads back to the woods
Above you can be seen a large netted area
The path northeast leads back to the woods
The path northwest leads back to the woods
The path southeast leads back to the woods
The path southwest leads back to the woods

rooms.Name: A wooded plain
rooms.Description:
This wood is lush and vibrant.  Even without looking, you can just 'feel'
the life in this area.  To the west, you can see a clearing with a single,
large tree in it.  From that direction, you can hear the sound of voices...

Exits.Description: To the north, the woods continue
To the south, the woods continue
You can see a large clearing with a single, towering tree in it
To the northwest, the woods continue
To the southwest, the woods continue

rooms.Name: A wooded plain
rooms.Description:
This wood is lush and vibrant.  Even without looking, you can just 'feel'
the life in this area.  To the southeast, you can see a clearing with a
single, large tree in it.  From that direction, you can hear the sound of
voices...

Exits.Description: To the east, the woods continue
To the south, the woods continue
You can see a large clearing with a single, towering tree in it

rooms.Name: A wooded shore
rooms.Description:
This part of the woods is more humid.  To the south lies the base of
Revelwood, surrounded by wooded plains.  To the north, you can see the
violent waters of the Soulease river.  The roar of the water is almost
deafening as if thunders past this shoreline.

Exits.Description: The Soulease river lies to the north, with it's dark, rushing waters
To the east, the woods continue
You can see a large clearing with a single, towering tree in it
To the west, the woods continue
To the southeast, the woods continue
To the southwest, the woods continue

rooms.Name: A wooded plain
rooms.Description:
This wood is lush and vibrant.  Even without looking, you can just 'feel'
the life in this area.  To the southwest, you can see a clearing with a
single, large tree in it.  From that direction, you can hear the sound of
voices...

Exits.Description: To the south, the woods continue
To the west, the woods continue
You can see a large clearing with a single, towering tree in it

rooms.Name: The Soulease river
rooms.Description:
The rough and violent waters of the Soulease here turn northerly, and
ease their activity, blending with the smoother waters of the White River.
On either side of the river, you can see the hills give way to smoother,
more flattened lands, which people have converted into fields, and begun
farming.

Exits.Description:
You can see the more violent waters of the Soulease stretching out to the 
east, leading back to the woods of Revelwood

You can see, to the northwest, the bend where the Soulease river ends, and
the gentler waters of the White river begin

rooms.Name: The Soulease River
rooms.Description:
You set out into the violent waters of the Soulease River.  Tossed hither
and fro by the waves, you soon begin to feel the slightest bit unwell, but
this is the only way to reach Revelstone Keep.

Exits.Description: To the east, you can see the deadly pounding of a violent waterfall!
You can see the shore at the northern edge of the woods of Revelwood

You can see the waters of the Soulease becoming more gentle as then mingle
with the waters of the White river

rooms.Name: The White River
rooms.Description:
This section of the river, called the White River because of the white sands
on the banks, is much smoother.  It meanders through the countryside, winding
between hills and fields ripe with grain and feed crops, and tended to by
people who's life has been dedicated to harvesting that which the land has
to offer.  They look happy and healthy, and wave merrily at you as you float
by on your way to Revelstone.

Exits.Description:
You can see a small lake that forms the end of the river, and beyond, a
large stone keep

You can see, to the southeast, the bend where the White river ends, and the
turbulent waters of the Soulease begin

rooms.Name: The northern end of the White River
rooms.Description:
Here the White river seems to end in a large pool.  Rumor has it that this
river continues underground, but no one was quite sure.  To the north, you
can see a white sand shore, and farther inland, a path leading towards a
large, intimidating, walled stone keep.

Exits.Description: To the north, you see a beautiful white sand beach
You can see the gentle waters of the White river

rooms.Name: A white sand beach
rooms.Description:
This beach is covered with pure white sand, giving the river whose waters lap
up onto it it's name.  The beach extends a ways to the north, and extends
around the edges of a small lake.  To the extreme north, you can see the
beginning of a path leading over a hill, heading towards a keep that can only
be Revelstone, the home of the Lords of the Land.

Exits.Description: You see a path leading north through the hills towards Revelstone
You see the small lake that ends the White rivers northward journey

rooms.Name: A path through the hills
rooms.Description:
The path beneath your feet is beaten through long grassy hills.  As you walk,
you come to an intersection of sorts, with paths going both to the north and
to the east.  To the north, the walls surrounding the large keep loom closer
than before, and you can make out a gate through the walls, as well as the
tower within.  To the east, the paths leads through the hills, and, far
away, into a thick, green forest.

Exits.Description: You can see the gates through the outer wall of Revelstone
To the east, another path leads onward through the hills.
You can see the white sand beach at the northern end of the White river

rooms.Name: The entrance to Revelstone
rooms.Description:
Through an enourmous gate, you can see a tunnel that leads into the central
area of Revelstone.  The gigantic walls look worn with the passage of time,
yet still strong enough to withstand any assault.  The stone seems somehow
alive and vibrant, as if it draws its strength directly from the live around
it.  The keep within looks tall and resolute, and you feel somehow awed as
you stand beneath its shadow.

Exits.Description: You can see, through an archway, the Close, the center of Revelstone
You can see the path leading back south through the hills

rooms.Name: The war room
rooms.Description:
This room contains several firepots for light and heat, and a waist-level
table which is covered in maps, troop lists and stategies for fighting the
Despisers armies.  You also see names of places familiar to you, like Mithil
Stonedown and Revelwood, as well as places you've never heard of.

Exits.Description: This archway leads back into the hall east of the Close

rooms.Name: The stairway
rooms.Description:
These stairs, which seem almost an extension of the stone that makes up
walls of the keep, circle upwards towards the second floor.  This part of
Revelstone appears a bit more comfortable, and it is on the second floor
that the Lords of the Land have their private rooms.

Exits.Description: Through this archway you can see the Close, the center of Revelstone
The stairs lead up to the second floor of Revelstone

rooms.Name: The Close
rooms.Description:
This is the central hall in Revelstone Keep: The Close.  It is here that
all other parts of the keep are accessable through, and it is also here that
the Lords of Revelstone meet to hear the problems of the people of the land
and to decide the laws that govern all who uphold goodness and law.  A low
hallway leads out to the east, a small holding cell is to the north, and
a stairway is seen through an archway to the west.  The entire hall is lit
with glowing pots which are tended to by the Gravelingases.

Exits.Description: This door leads to a small, dark holding cell
This archway leads into a slightly narrow hallway
South, you see the entrance to the close, leading you back outside
Through this archway, you see stairs going up

rooms.Name: A hallway
rooms.Description:
This is a slightly narrow hallway leading from the close to a 'T' 
intersection.  To the north, the smell of fresh air draws your gaze to an
archway into an enclosed courtyard.  To the south you can see a small room
with a parchment-covered table.  It appears to be a meeting room of sorts.

Exits.Description: This archway leads to an open-air terrace of some sort

Through this archway, a small room with a table covered in parchments can
be seen
This archway leads back into the Close, the center of Revelstone

rooms.Name: A holding cell
rooms.Description:
This is a dark room, with no visable light source, save what filters in
from the doorway.  There is no other exit, except the door to the south.

Exits.Description: Past the door, you can see the Close, the center of Revelstone

rooms.Name: Training field
rooms.Description:
This area is an open-air terrace which has been converted into a training
field for the warriors of Revelstone.  It is here that Warmark Quann and
First-Haft Amorine train the young men and women to defend the peoples of
the land.

Exits.Description: Through this archway, the hallway east of the Close can be seen

rooms.Name: Hall of Artifacts
rooms.Description:
This is the Hall of Artifacts.  Herein lie all the treasures of the Land
that are either unusable or undecipherable by the Lords.  There are all
manner of objects and scrolls here.  Nothing looks familiar, and you can't
understand the language the scrolls are written in, but this must be very
important to the Lords for them to take such precautions to keep it secure.

Exits.Description: Banded with blue-tinted iron, this door looks impenitrable

rooms.Name: Lord Hyrims quarters
rooms.Description:
This is the room of Lord Hyrim.  You can tell from the furninshings of this
chamber that this lord is one who is fond of wine and food.  This room has
a simple bed, bureau and wardrobe.

Exits.Description: This door leads back the the stairs

rooms.Name: 2nd floor stairway
rooms.Description:
The stairs end at this landing.  There are doors leading north, south, east
and west, as well as a small circular staircase leading up to a trapdoor in
the ceiling.  These doors all look the same, except for the door leading
south, which stands barred and obviously locked.  You have to wonder what
is so important that it must be so heavily guarded against intrusion...

Exits.Description: This door leads to Lord Mhoram's chambers
This door leads to the chambers of Lord Shetra
Banded with blue-tinted iron, this door looks almost impenitrable
This door leads to Lord Hyrim's chambers
This door leads to High Lord Elena's chambers
These stairs lead back down to the first floor of Revelstone

rooms.Name: Lord Shetra's quarters
rooms.Description:
This is the chamber of Lord Shetra.  Apart from the bed, bureau and small
wardrobe, there is very little here to help you know her, except for a small
stone heart hung on her wall, with the word "Variol" impressed into it.

Exits.Description: This door leads back to the stairway

rooms.Name: Lord Mhoram's quarters
rooms.Description:
This is Lord Mhoram's chambers.  Here are a collection of items that give
you a true sense of the compassion of this individual.  Here are several
paintings and sculptures, along with a bed, bureau and small wardrobe.

Exits.Description: This door leads back to the stairway

rooms.Name: High Lord Elana's quarters
rooms.Description:
This is the chambers of the Elena, the High Lord of the Council of Lords of
Revelstone Keep.  She has been head of the council for over a score years, and
is rumored to be the grand-daughter of Thomas Covenant himself.  Her room is
rather bare, except for a beautiful stone sculpture of a bearded man in robes,
with only three fingers on his left hand.

Exits.Description: This door leads back down to the second floor of Revelstone

ExtraDescs.Description:
This statues seems far too smooth to have been carved.  You surmise that it
must have been made by a special stone-melding magic.  The figure represented
in the sculpture has a severe visage, but his eyes seems kind, almost gentle,
and on his half-hand is the visage of a ring...

rooms.Name: The Hills of Andelain
rooms.Description:
These hills are lush with life, and a feeling of peace eiminates from the
very ground you walk upon.  That feeling of peace is shattered, though, by
a very strong sense of an evil presence.  Over the hills, you can see small
dancing motes of light.  Could these be the fabled wraiths of Andelain?

Exits.Description: To the north the Hills of Andelain continue
To the west, the Hills of Andelain spread before you.
To the northwest the base of the Tree-town Soaring Woodhelven can be seen.

rooms.Name: The Forest of Grimmerdhore
rooms.Description:
These forests have none of the tranquility of the Revelwood woods.  Here,
there seems an almost perceptable feeling of evil, eminating from the east.
Looking eastward, you see the forest give wayto the hills of Andelain.  They
appear lush and inviting, but the feeling of dread persists.

Exits.Description: To the north the forest of Grimmerdhore continues.
To the east is the base of the Tree-town of Soaring Woodhelven.
To the south, the forest of Grimmerdhore continues.
To the northeast the forest of Grimmerdhore continues.
To the southeast, you can see the Hills of Andelain beginning.

rooms.Name: Soaring Woodhelven
rooms.Description:
This is the base of the tree-town of Soaring Woodhelven.  Poised in the
forest of Grimmerdhore and on the edge of the Hills of Andelain, this large
tree is home to hardy folk of the land.  They live here, far from the
protection of the Lords, and in the shadow of Mount Thunder.

Exits.Description: To the northwest is the forest of Grimmerdhore.
To the south, you see the Hills of Andelain.
To the west, you can see the Forests of Grimmerdhore.
Above you is the central meeting place of Soaring Woodhelven.
To the northwest is the forest of Grimmerdhore.
To the southeast you see the Hills of Andelain
To the southwest you see the forest of Grimmerdhore.

rooms.Name: The Hills of Andelain
rooms.Description:
These hills are lush with life, and a feeling of peace eminates from the
very ground you walk upon.  That feeling of peace is shattered, though by
a very strong sense of an evil presence.  Over the hills, you can see small,
dancing motes of light.  Could these be the fabled wraiths of Andelain?

Exits.Description: This path heads east towards Mount Thunder.
To the south, the Hills of Andelain continue.
To the southwest, the Hills of Andelain continue.

rooms.Name: The Forest of Grimmerdhore
rooms.Description:
These forests have none of the tranquility of the Revelwood woods.  Here,
there seems an almost perceptable feeling of evil, eminating from the east.
Looking eastward, you see the forest give way to the hills of Andelain.
They appear lush and inviting, but the feeling of dread persists.

Exits.Description: To the east, the Forest of Grimmerdhore continues.
To the south the Forest of Grimmerdhore continues.
To the northwest, you can see a beautiful field of waving grain.
To the southeast the base of the Tree-town of Soaring Woodhelven can be seen.

rooms.Name: The Forest of Grimmerdhore
rooms.Description:
These forests have none of the tranquility of the Revelwood woods.  Here,
there seems an almost perceptable feeling of evil, eminating from the east.
Looking southeast-ward, you see the forest give way to the Hills of Andelain.
They appear lush and inviting, but the feeling of dread persists.

Exits.Description: To the south you can see the base of the Tree-town Soaring Woodhelven.
To the west the Forest of Grimmerdhore continues.
To the southwest the Forest of Grimmerdhore continues.

rooms.Name: Soaring Woodhelven
rooms.Description:
This is the central square of Soaring Woodhelven.  It is here that councils
of peace and war are held.  Below is the base of this massive tree-village,
and above your heads is the home and office of the Heer of the Woodhelven.

Exits.Description: Above you is the home of the Heer of the Woodhelven.
Below, you see the base of Soaring Woodhelven.

rooms.Name: A rocky path
rooms.Description:
Here, the woods quickly give way to rocky terrain, as the path leads quickly
into the mountains.  It is here, below the peak known as Mount Thunder, that
Drool Rockworm resides in Kiril Threndor, the seat of the cavewights power.
The terrain grows quickly more treacherous, and footing becomes questionable.

Exits.Description: To the west the path leads into the Hills of Andelain.
This path leads into the mountains, towards Mt. Thunder.

rooms.Name: A rocky path
rooms.Description:
This path leads through the mountanous countryside just west of Mount
Thunder.  The air is dry and uncomfortable, and the mountain looms darkly
to the east, casting a death-like pall over the entire area.

Exits.Description: To the east, the path leads onto the lower slopes of Mount Thunder.
This path leads back towards the Hills of Andelain.

rooms.Name: The Slopes of Mount Thunder
rooms.Description:
You stand on the lower slopes of Mount Thunder.  Above you, the mount
itself peaks towards the sky.  It looks ominous and threatening for some
reason, and you feel very small next to it.  To the southeast, the
path continues, and to the east, you can see a very small cave opening into
the mount itself.

Exits.Description: This cave entrance leads into Mount Thunder.
To the west, a rocky path leads west out of the mountains.
This path leads towards the Plains of Ra.

rooms.Name: A cave entrance
rooms.Description:
This low cavern leads back and down, into the bowels of Mount Thunder.
From somewhere below, you can hear the sounds of someone, or something, moving
around, and occasionally a screech of rage filters up from the depths. You
can only imagine what lies below you.

Exits.Description:
To the west, through the cave entrance, you can see the lower slopes of
Mount Thunder.
This passage leads down into Mount Thunder.

rooms.Name: The passage to Kiril Threndor
rooms.Description:
The passage leads down into a full cavern, with a bridge over a river of
lava that flows through this cavern.  There is a blue barrier of some kind
stretching across the center of the bridge.  This appears to be a locked word
of binding, and nothing save the the conjuring staff can unlock it.  A
lord could bend the binding, but you don't have one with you.

Exits.Description: The word of binding stretches across the bridge here, blocking your path.
This passage leads up to the cave entrance to Kiril Threndor.

ExtraDescs.Description:
To the north, this sheet of blue energy stretches completely across the
bridge.  The smell of ozone is sharp in the air, and as you toss a rock at
the word as a test, it is vaporized by the power of the binding.  The ONLY
way you can get through this is to unlock it with the staff that created it.

rooms.Name: A darkened passage
rooms.Description:
This is a low, dark, dank passage from the river of lava towards Kiril
Threndor, the seat of Drool Rockworm's power.  Further down this passage,
you can see a light, and hear more clearly the rantings and ravings of a
madman.  You can only assume this is Drool.

Exits.Description: To the north, an antechamber can be seen.
To the south, you see the word of binding across the lava river bridge.

rooms.Name: Antechamber
rooms.Description:
This room is the antechamber of Kiril Threndor.  To the north lies the
throne room where Drool Rockworm is said to be.  Echoes of his ranting are
still in the air as you survey this chamber.

Exits.Description: To the north, the cavernous chamber of Kiril Threndor can be seen.
To the south is a dark passage back out of Kiril Threndor.

rooms.Name: Kiril Threndor
rooms.Description:
As you enter this cavernous chamber, you realize that this is Kiril
Threndor, the dark heart of Mount Thunder.  The room is dimly lit by a
softly glowing type of rock imbedded into the walls.  In the center of the
room is a raised dias of blackened rock which looks like it was once
whole, and has been melted to it's present shape by an incredible force.

Exits.Description: The northern wall of this chamber looks a bit.....unusual.
To the south you can see the Antechamber to Kiril Threndor

rooms.Name: Hidden Chamber
rooms.Description:
This room is small and dark.  The only exit is south, through the hidden
door back into Kiril Threndor.  In this room, there is a small, slender stone
dias, standing about waist level.  It almost seems as though the dias was
raised up out of the very stone.

Exits.Description: The wall on the northern edge of the cavern looks a bit.....unusual.

rooms.Name: A long path
rooms.Description:
This long pathway leads from the slopes of Mount Thunder, and farther to
the southeast, into the fabled Plains of Ra.  As you travel this pathway,
you marvel at the size of the Land and the variety of life in it.

Exits.Description: To the northwest, you can see the slopes of Mount Thunder.
To the southeast, you can see the beginning of the Plains of Ra.

rooms.Name: The Plains of Ra
rooms.Description:
As far as the eye can see are acres and acres of tall grasses, waving in
the warm, mild breezes that roll across this area.  These are the plains of
Ra, home to the Ranyhyn, the great noble horses of the Land.

Exits.Description: To the north, the plains continue.
To the east, the plains continue.
To the northeast, the plains continue.

rooms.Name: The Plains of Ra
rooms.Description:
As far as the eye can see are acres and acres of tall grasses, waving in
the warm, mild breezes that roll across this area.  These are the Plains of
Ra, home to the Ranyhyn, the great noble horses of the Land.

Exits.Description: To the north, the plains continue.
To the east, the plains continue.
To the west, the plains continue.
To the northeast, the plains continue.
To the northwest, the plains continue.

rooms.Name: The Plains of Ra
rooms.Description:
As far as the eye can see are acres and acres of tall grasses, waving in
the warm, mild breezes that roll across this area.  These are the Plains of
Ra, home to the Ranyhyn, the great noble horses of the Land.

Exits.Description: To the north, the plains continue.
To the east, the plains continue.
To the west, the plains continue.
To the northeast, the plains continue.
To the northwest, the plains continue.

rooms.Name: The Plains of Ra
rooms.Description:
As far as the eye can see are acres and acres of tall grasses, waving in
the warm, mild breezes that roll across this area.  These are the Plains of
Ra, home to the Ranyhyn, the great noble horses of the Land.

Exits.Description: To the north, the plains continue.
To the west, the plains continue.
To the northwest, the plains continue.

the warm, mild breezes that roll across this area.  These are the Plains of
Ra, home to the Ranyhyn, the great noble horses of the Land.

Exits.Description: To the north, the plains continue.
To the east, the plains continue.
To the south, the plains continue.
To the northeast, the plains continue.
To the southeast, the plains continue.

the warm, mild breezes that roll across this area.  These are the Plains of
Ra, home to the Ranyhyn, the great noble horses of the Land.

Exits.Description: To the north, the plains continue.
To the east, the plains continue.
To the south, the plains continue.
To the west, the plains continue.
To the northeast, the plains continue.
To the northwest, the plains continue.
To the southeast, the plains continue.
To the southwest, the plains continue.

the warm, mild breezes that roll across this area.  These are the Plains of
Ra, home to the Ranyhyn, the great noble horses of the Land.

Exits.Description: To the north, the plains continue.
To the east, the plains continue.
To the south, the plains continue.
To the west, the plains continue.
To the northeast, the plains continue.
To the northwest, the plains continue.
To the southeast, the plains continue.
To the southwest, the plains continue.

rooms.Description:

the warm, mild breezes that roll across this area.  These are the Plains of
Ra, home to the Ranyhyn, the great noble horses of the Land.

Exits.Description: To the north, the plains continue.
To the south, the plains continue.
To the west, the plains continue.
To the northeast, you see a path leading into the Shattered Hills.
To the northwest, the plains continue.
To the southwest, the plains continue.

rooms.Description:

the warm, mild breezes that roll across this area.  These are the Plains of
Ra, home to the Ranyhyn, the great noble horses of the Land.

Exits.Description: To the north, the plains continue.
To the east, the plains continue.
To the south, the plains continue.
To the northeast, the plains continue.
To the southeast, the plains continue.

Ra, home to the Ranyhyn, the great noble horses of the Land.

Exits.Description: To the north, the plains continue.
To the east, the plains continue.
To the south, the plains continue.
To the west, the plains continue.

To the southwest, the plains continue.

To the southwest, the plains continue.

the warm, mild breezes that roll across this area.  These are the Plains of
Ra, home to the Ranyhyn, the great noble horses of the Land.

Exits.Description: To the north, the plains continue.
To the east, you see a path leading towards the Shattered Hills.
To the south, the plains continue.
To the west, the plains continue.
To the northwest, the plains continue.
To the southwest, the plains continue.

rooms.Description:

the warm, mild breezes that roll across this area.  These are the Plains of
Ra, home to the Ranyhyn, the great noble horses of the Land.

Exits.Description: To the east, the plains continue.
To the south, the plains continue.
To the northwest, the plains continue.
To the southeast, the plains continue.

rooms.Description:

the warm, mild breezes that roll across this area.  These are the Plains of
Ra, home to the Ranyhyn, the great noble horses of the Land.

Exits.Description: To the east, the plains continue.
To the south, the plains continue.
To the west, the plains continue.
To the southeast, the plains continue.
To the southwest, the plains continue.

rooms.Name: The Plains of Ra
rooms.Description:
As far as the eye can see are acres and acres of tall grasses, waving in
the warm, mild breezes that roll across this area.  These are the Plains of
Ra, home to the Ranyhyn, the great noble horses of the Land.

Exits.Description: To the east, the plains continue.
To the south, the plains continue.
To the west, the plains continue.
To the southeast, the plains continue.
To the southwest, the plains continue.

rooms.Name: The Plains of Ra
rooms.Description:
As far as the eye can see are acres and acres of tall grasses, waving in
the warm, mild breezes that roll across this area.  These are the Plains of
Ra, home to the Ranyhyn, the great noble horses of the Land.

Exits.Description: To the south, the plains continue.
To the west, the plains continue.
To the southeast, a path leads towards the Shattered Hills.
To the southwest, the plains continue.

rooms.Name: A path into the mountains
rooms.Description:
This path leads away from the Plains of Ra, and turns towards the crags of
the Shattered Hills.  The pathway forks here, going both northeast and
southeast.  To the northeast, you can see the red glow of Lava as the molten
River known as Hotash Slay flows slowly across the path.  To the southeast,
you see a treacherous path as it winds upwards along a high cliff face.
If only you knew which path was safer to travel...

Exits.Description: To the west, you can see the Plains of Ra.
To the northeast, you can see a deadly river of Lava!

To the southeast, you can see a treacherous looking path leading along a
ridge into the mountains of the Shattered Hills.

rooms.Name: Hotash Slay
rooms.Description:
You have entered Hotash Slay, the lava river that runs the north-western
edge of the Shattered Hills.  If you were a giant, you could do this without
injury.  But, as you're not, this hurts a LOT!  What ever possessed you
to wade into a lava river?

Exits.Description: Here is the pathway into the shattered hills.

rooms.Name: The Ridge Path
rooms.Description:
As you climb this treacherous path, the ground drops away beneath your
feet.  You can see, to the southeast, the path goes higher and higher into
the Shattered Hills.  There, amidst the rocky crags, lies Foul's Creche,
the seat of the evil power that is infesting this land.

Exits.Description: To the northwest, you can see a path leading out of the mountains.
To the southeast, a path through the mountains can be seen.

rooms.Name: Mountain Path
rooms.Description:
This pathway leave the ridge path, and travels deep into the crags of the
mountains of the Shattered Hills.  To the southeast, you can see the path
leads up to a large spire with a huge double door set in it.

Exits.Description: To the northwest, you can see a path along a steep ridge.
To the southeast, a huge spire with doors set into it can be seen.

rooms.Name: A mountain spire
rooms.Description:
This spire in the Shattered Hills reaches towards the sky in an almost
obscene fashion, as if hurling insults to the very stars.  Imbedded in the
spire is a large set of double doors, leading east.  The doors look like
they have been there forever, and have stood the test of time against
thieves and heroes alike.

Exits.Description: To the east, you see a large set of double doors.
To the northwest, a path meanders through the mountains.

rooms.Name: Entrance Hall
rooms.Description:
This is the entrance hall to Foul's Creche.  You can feel the evil as you
enter this place.  It's like smoke: it chokes you, clings to you, and makes
you feel as if you will never be able to rid yourself of it.  To the east,
the ground slopes sharply down, and you can hear noises from that direction.

Exits.Description: To the east, the tunnel slopes down towards Foul's Creche proper.
To the west, you can see a large set of double doors.

rooms.Name: A low stone cavern
rooms.Description:
This low stone cavern has no visible light, and the rough stone walls
seem to exude a sense of oily, permeating evil.  This area has a very
ominous feel to it, as if your death were waiting just around the bend...

Exits.Description: To the north, the cavern continues.
To the east, the cavern continues.

rooms.Name: A low stone cavern
rooms.Description:
This low stone cavern has no visible light, and the rough stone walls
seem to exude a sense of oily, permeating evil.  This area has a very
ominous feel to it, as if your death were waiting just around the bend...

Exits.Description: To the north, the cavern continues.
To the west, the cavern continues.

rooms.Name: A low stone cavern
rooms.Description:
This low stone cavern has no visible light, and the rough stone walls
seem to exude a sense of oily, permeating evil.  This area has a very
ominous feel to it, as if your death were waiting just around the bend...

Exits.Description: To the north, the cavern continues.
To the south, the cavern continues.
To the west, you can see the entrance to Foul's Creche.

rooms.Name: A low stone cavern
rooms.Description:
This low stone cavern has no visible light, and the rough stone walls
seem to exude a sense of oily, permeating evil.  This area has a very
ominous feel to it, as if your death were waiting just around the bend...

Exits.Description: To the north, the cavern continues.
To the east, the cavern opens up into a huge chamber.
To the south, the cavern continues.

rooms.Name: A low stone cavern
rooms.Description:
This low stone cavern has no visible light, and the rough stone walls
seem to exude a sense of oily, permeating evil.  This area has a very
ominous feel to it, as if your death were waiting just around the bend...

Exits.Description: To the east, the cavern continues.
To the south, the cavern continues.

rooms.Name: A low stone cavern
rooms.Description:
This low stone cavern has no visible light, and the rough stone walls
seem to exude a sense of oily, permeating evil.  This area has a very
ominous feel to it, as if your death were waiting just around the bend...

Exits.Description: To the south, the cavern continues.
To the west, the cavern continues.

rooms.Name: A large stone cavern
rooms.Description:
As you enter this huge cavern, the evil hits you like a stiff wind of
corruption.  This is Foul's Creche, the seat of evil and corruption in the
Land.  Towards the back of the chamber, in front of a tunnel leading further
to the east, there is a large stone dias with a huge throne, made of a
thick, black rock.  The throne itself seems to glow with a slight, sickened
greenish tinge, providing you with the visual equivilant of a bad smell.

Exits.Description: To the east, you can see a door with a sick green light glowing at the edges.
To the west, you see a low stone cavern.

rooms.Name: A glowing green cavern
rooms.Description:
This cavern glows with a residual green light that instantly makes you
feel like wretching.  This light seems to contain all the 'wrongness' of
betrayal, death, disease, famine, greed, despair, and corruption.  This is
the illearth chamber, the home of the illearth stone.  You feel ill.

Exits.Description: To the north, an odd blue portal seems to lead elsewhere.
To the west, you can see a door leading to Foul's Creche.

rooms.Name: Path from Revelstone
rooms.Description:
This pathway leads from the entrance of Revelstone to the east.  Far off
in the distance, you can see a large forest, and a beautiful tree that grows
in the center of it.  It looks similar to Revelwood, but this tree seems to
have a feeling of sadness to it, even from this distance.

Exits.Description: To the east, the path leads into a large, grassy field.
To the west, you can see the intersection with the path to Revelstone.

rooms.Name: Path into Grimmerdhore
rooms.Description:
The hills give way to beautiful field of tall, waving grasses.  To the
southeast, you can see the Forest of Grimmerdhore, and in the center of it,
the tree-village of Soaring Woodhelven, sitting in the shadow of Mount
Thunder to the east.

Exits.Description: To the west, the path grows more hilly, and leads back to Revelstone.
To the southeast, you see the forest of Grimmerdhore

rooms.Name: The Forest of Grimmerdhore
rooms.Description:
These forests have none of the tranquility of the Revelwood woods.  Here,
there seems an almost perceptable feeling of evil, eminating from the east.
Looking eastward, you see the forest give way to the hills of Andelain.
They appear lush and inviting, but the feeling of dread persists.

Exits.Description: To the north the forest of Grimmerdhore continues.
To the east you can see the Hills of Andelain.
To the northeast you can see the base of the Tree-town of Soaring Woodhelven.

rooms.Name: The Hills of Andelain
rooms.Description:
These hills are lush with life, and a feeling of peace eminates from the
very ground you walk upon.  That feeling of peace is shattered, though, by
a very strong sense of an evil presence.  Over the hills, you can see small,
dancing motes of light.  Could these be the fabled wraiths of Andelain?

Exits.Description: To the north you can see the base of the Tree-town of Soaring Woodhelven.
The the east the Hills of Andelain continue.
To the west, you can see the forests of Grimmerdhore.
To the northeast the Hills of Andelain continue.
To the northwest you can see the forest of Grimmerdhore.

rooms.Name: A long stairway
rooms.Description:
This stairway seems to go on forever.  As you finally descend through the
clouds, you can see you have hundreds of feet to go.  The surface of the
earth never looked so good as you approach...

Exits.Description: Up these stairs is the plateau called Kevin's Watch
Down these stairs, you can see the surface of the land

rooms.Name: The Heer's Chambers
rooms.Description:
Here is the chamber of Llaura, the Heer of Soaring Woodhelven.  It is here
that the decisions regarding the safety and properity of the entire 
Woodhelven is made.  The room is sparse and utilitarian, and seems to give
off a sense of seriousness and dedication.

Exits.Description: Below, you can see the central meeting chamber of the Woodhelven.

rooms.Name: The center of Revelwood
rooms.Description:
You stand within the large, central area of Revelwood.  All about you, a
net has been drawn of vine and attached to various branches, creating a
flexible plateau of sorts, which allow for large numbers of people to all
gather in one place.  This appears to be the main social area of this
rather unusual village, and is suprisingly stable for it's construct.

Exits.Description: Looking up, you see a large hollow in the tree trunk
You look down and see the base of Revelwood

rooms.Name: The Loresraat
rooms.Description:
Here is the center of learning for the land.  Here, the secrets of High
Lord Kevin's lore are studied.  The secrets of the lillianril are
attempted by the Hirebrands, and the mysteries of the Rhadhamaerl are
studied by the Gravelingases.  All the lore that is learned here is passed
on the lord of Revelstone for use by those entrusted with the care of
the land.  Here, in what seems a natural hollow in the trunk of this
enourmous tree, the sense of earthpower is truly staggering!

Exits.Description: Looking down, you can see the netted main area of Revelwood

rooms.Name: The Plains of Ra
rooms.Description:
As far as the eye can see are acres and acres of tall grasses, waving in
the warm, mild breezes that roll across this area.  It is here that the
Ramen, the people whose lives are dedicated to tending the Ranyhyn, have 
set up their camp.  Here is where the ramen congregate, to get their
water, and to socialize.

Exits.Description: To the northeast, the plains continue.
To the northwest, the plains continue.
To the southeast, the plains continue.
To the southwest, the plains continue.

rooms.Name: Transition point
rooms.Description: This is a flat, featurless point in netherspace.

Exits.Description: Below, you can see flat rock...
